cufy.concurrent

Class Instructor

  • java.lang.Object
    • cufy.concurrent.Instructor

  • public class Instructor
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to be the communication method between 2 (or more) threads (loops). Used as a tasks list for unknown count unknown state loops.
    Since:
    18 May 2019
    Version:
    0.1.3
    Author:
    lsafer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<Loop<?,?>> loops
      Loops that linked to this.
      protected java.util.List<java.util.function.BiFunction<Instructor,Loop<?,?>,java.lang.Boolean>> posts
      All undone posts of this group.
      protected java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.String> state
      The first position of any further loop get started by this.

        Note: synchronized use only.

        Note: synchronized use only.

      • getLoops

        public Instructor getLoops(java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.List<Loop<?,?>>> action)
        Do the given action to the loops of this. with a locked access.

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

        Parameters:
        action - to be done to the loops list of this
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'action' is null
        See Also:
        getLoops()

        public boolean isAlive()

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

      • join

        public Instructor join()
        Waits for all loops of this group to die.

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        Loop.join()

      • join

        public Instructor join(java.util.function.Consumer<Instructor> alter,
                       long millis)
        Waits at most millis milliseconds for all loops of this group to die.

        Note: this may not be useful if this loop rapidly starts and finishes

        Parameters:
        alter - what to do when the timeout is done
        millis - the time to wait in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value of millis is negative
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given alter is null
        See Also:
        Loop.join(Consumer, long)

      • notify

        public Instructor notify(java.lang.String state)
        Update the state of every currently or further running loops in this group.
        Parameters:
        state - the new state
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given state is null
        See Also:
        Loop.notify(String)

      • pair

        public Instructor pair()
        Wait until make sure that there is a running loop on this group. By adding a new post and wait until get executed. Useful when starting a new loop on a new thread. To make sure that that loop started running.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        Loop.pair()

      • post

        public Instructor post(java.util.function.BiFunction<Instructor,Loop<?,?>,java.lang.Boolean> action)
        Make a loop of this group do the given action. Then remove that action if the action returns false.
        Parameters:
        action - to be done by a loop of this group (return false to remove the action)
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given action is null
        See Also:
        Loop.post(Function)

      • post

        public Instructor post(java.util.function.BiFunction<Instructor,Loop<?,?>,java.lang.Boolean> action,
                       java.util.function.Consumer<Instructor> alter)
        Make a loop of this group do the given action. hen remove that action if the action returns false. Or if this group don't have a running loop.

        Note: no matter what. One (AND JUST ONE) of the given actions should be invoked.

        Parameters:
        action - to be done by a loop of this (return false to remove the action)
        alter - the action to be done if this group don't have a running loop
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'action' or the given 'alter' is null
        See Also:
        Loop.post(Function, Consumer)

      • post

        public Instructor post(java.util.function.BiFunction<Instructor,Loop<?,?>,java.lang.Boolean> action,
                       java.util.function.Consumer<Instructor> alter,
                       long timeout)
        Make a loop of this group do the given action. Then remove that action if the action returns false. Or the given timeout ended.

        Note: no matter what. One (AND JUST ONE) of the given actions should be invoked.

        Parameters:
        action - to be done by a loop of this group
        alter - to do when timeout and the action has not been done
        timeout - the timeout (in milli seconds)
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'action' or 'alter' is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if ether the given 'timeout' is negative
        See Also:
        Loop.post(Function, Consumer, long)

      • start

        public Instructor start(Loop<?,?> loop)
        Start a loop using this Instructor.
        Parameters:
        loop - to be started
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given loop is null
        See Also:
        Loop.start()

      • synchronously

        public Instructor synchronously(java.util.function.BiConsumer<Instructor,Loop<?,?>> action)
        Make a loop of this group do the given action. And WAIT for that loop to do it; If the CALLER thread get interrupted while it's waiting on this method. Then the action will be canceled.
        Parameters:
        action - to be done by a loop of this group
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given 'action' is null
        See Also:
        Loop.synchronously(Consumer)

      • synchronously

        public Instructor synchronously(java.util.function.BiConsumer<Instructor,Loop<?,?>> action,
                                java.util.function.Consumer<Instructor> alter)
        Make a loop of this group do the given action. And WAIT for that loop to do. Or if this group don't have a running loop (currently).

        Note: this may not be useful if this group rapidly starts and finishes loops

        Note: no matter what. One (AND JUST ONE) of the given actions should be invoked once (also, JUST ONCE).

        Note: action SHOULDN'T be synchronously invoked on ANY non-local object

        Parameters:
        action - to be done by a loop of this group
        alter - to be done if there is no loop on this group (currently)
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'action' or 'alter' is null
        See Also:
        Loop.synchronously(Consumer, Consumer)

      • synchronously

        public Instructor synchronously(java.util.function.BiConsumer<Instructor,Loop<?,?>> action,
                                java.util.function.Consumer<Instructor> alter,
                                long timeout)
        Make a loop of this group do the given action. And WAIT until that loop invokes it. Or the given timeout ended.

        Note: no matter what. One (AND JUST ONE) of the given actions should be invoked once (also, JUST ONCE).

        Parameters:
        action - to be done by a loop of this group
        alter - to be done if the timeout ended
        timeout - to wait for the action to be invoked (milli seconds)
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ether the given 'action' or 'alter' is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given 'timeout' is negative
        See Also:
        Loop.synchronously(Consumer, Consumer, long)

      • thread

        public Instructor thread(Loop<?,?> loop)
        Start the given loop with a new thread.
        Parameters:
        loop - to be started
        Returns:
        the new started thread
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given loop is null
        See Also:
        Loop.thread()

      • tick

        public Instructor tick()
        Do the posts posted on this group. With no caller.

        Note: this designed to be called by a loop of this instructor

        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when a post tris doing anything to the caller without doing a null check

      • tick

        public Instructor tick(Loop<?,?> caller)
        Do the posts posted on this group. With the caller param of the given loop.
        Parameters:
        caller - the caller loop
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when the 'caller' is null and a post tris doing anything to the caller without doing a null check
        IllegalThreadException - if the 'caller' isn't null and the caller thread ins't the thread of the given loop
